definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Are you willing to return, escorted by me?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意回去吗，由我来护送？

sentences.english: Escort the emperor silver team from wu founded the mountain after.
sentences.chinese: 护送皇银的车队从武南庄山下经过之时。

sentences.english: A group of people fro, amid is escorted Xu Shiyou team.
sentences.chinese: 山沟里走来一队人马，正是护送许世友的队伍。

sentences.english: The policeman conducted us safely to the railway station.
sentences.chinese: 警察把我们安全地护送到火车站。

sentences.english: Blade please chicken rice seed seeking from waterway escorted out of the city of hu pictureque method.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋拜托鸡饭仔寻求从水路护送胡畔出城之法。

sentences.english: Eventually, red-shirt guards had to escort her out of the area to a spot in front of the President Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 最后，红衫警卫护送她离开直到总统饭店前面。

sentences.english: I used to escort Mathur's daughter to her husband's chamber with the maidservant.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经与女佣一起护送马图尔的女儿到她丈夫的房间。

sentences.english: He was escorted back to the nether regions of Main Street.
sentences.chinese: 他被护送回中央大道南面的地方。

sentences.english: All the soldiers in the escort were yelling excitedly and pointing to something in the water.
sentences.chinese: 护送粮食的军兵们都指着水面上的东西兴奋地喊叫着。

sentences.english: The fleet convoyed the mothership into the port.
sentences.chinese: 这支舰队护送母舰进港。

sentences.english: Li himself escorted the first shipment of supplies two days later.
sentences.chinese: 在两天后，李连杰自己护送了一批救援物资。

sentences.english: Once I dreamt of an egg. I have to bring the egg in a sedan chair to a place safely and soundly.
sentences.chinese: 我的任务是坐着旧式的轿子，护送一个蛋去一个地方。

sentences.english: As it is rather late, shall I escort you home?
sentences.chinese: 天色已晚，我护送你们回家吧？

sentences.english: The warships convoyed the merchant ships across the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 战舰护送商船穿过太平洋。

sentences.english: She quit and escorted the wounded man back.
sentences.chinese: 她退出了比赛护送伤员回去。

sentences.english: What should he find but a military convoy ?
sentences.chinese: 除了一支军事护送队以外，他还会发现什么呢？

definition: to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
to escort (goods or funds)/to convey under guard
to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to stay behind to take care of things
to tail behind/to tag along/to follow on the heels of
